items.content:
1407: :label: cor-effective-interaction-radius-full
1408: 
1409: Define the **effective interaction radius** by setting the tail probability to $\delta = 1/k$:
1410: 
1411: $$
1412: R_{\text{eff}} = \sqrt{R_{\max}^2 + 2\varepsilon_c^2 \log(k^2)} = \varepsilon_c \sqrt{C_{\text{comp}}^2 + 2\log(k^2)}
1413: 
1414: $$
1415: 
1416: Then:
1417: 
1418: $$
1419: \mathbb{P}(d_{\text{alg}}(i, c(i)) > R_{\text{eff}}) \leq \frac{1}{k}
1420: 
1421: $$

items.title: Gevrey-1 Classification
items.content:
4678: :label: cor-gevrey-1-fitness-potential-full
4679: 
4680: The fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}$ belongs to the **Gevrey-1 class**, meaning it is **real-analytic** with convergent Taylor series in a neighborhood of each point.
4681: 
4682: Specifically, for any compact set $K \subset \mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d$:
4683: 
4684: $$
4685: \sup_{(x,v) \in K} \|\nabla^m V_{\text{fit}}(x,v)\| \leq A \cdot B^m \cdot m!
4686: 
4687: $$

items.label: cor-exponential-qsd-companion-dependent-full
items.title: Exponential Convergence to QSD (Conditional)
items.content:
5061: :label: cor-exponential-qsd-companion-dependent-full
5062: 
5063: **If** {prf:ref}`conj-lsi-companion-dependent-full` holds, then the Geometric Gas with companion-dependent fitness converges exponentially to its unique quasi-stationary distribution:
5064: 
5065: $$
5066: \|\rho_t - \nu_{\text{QSD}}\|_{L^2(\mu)} \leq e^{-\lambda_{\text{gap}} t} \|\rho_0 - \nu_{\text{QSD}}\|_{L^2(\mu)}
5067: 
5068: $$
5069: 
5070: where $\lambda_{\text{gap}} \geq \alpha > 0$ is the **spectral gap**, independent of $N$ and $k$.

items.label: cor-gevrey-closure
items.title: Gevrey-1 Closure Under Smooth Composition
items.content:
5464: :label: cor-gevrey-closure
5465: 
5466: If $f: \mathbb{R}^k \to \mathbb{R}$ is Gevrey-1 (satisfies $\|\nabla^m f\| \leq C_f m! \rho^{-m}$) and $g_1, \ldots, g_k: \mathbb{R}^d \to \mathbb{R}$ are each Gevrey-1 with $\|\nabla^m g_i\| \leq C_i m! \sigma^{-m}$, then the composition:
5467: 
5468: $$
5469: h(x) = f(g_1(x), \ldots, g_k(x))
5470: 
5471: $$
5472: 
5473: is Gevrey-1 with:
5474: 
5475: $$
5476: \|\nabla^m h\| \leq C_h m! \cdot \max(\rho, \sigma)^{-m}
5477: 
5478: $$
